content: Sarah- I understand the right of passage, the technological obstacles and the changes in a woman’s mind. If you can put my gender aside for a moment, you might consider a few alternative views. Not all women feel it’s all that important to actually birth a child they raise — some women taking advantage of surrogate services in the US and overseas are perfectly fertile, and want a baby but don’t want a pregnancy. This is called social surrogacy. Some women don’t want the physiological effects of the pregnancy. Some don’t want to interrupt their careers. Women make these choices all the time. An artifical womb is a tool for giving women more choice, not for male oppression.
